home.introduction: Hello, I am Andrew López Herrera. I am a Computer Engineering student at the Limón Academic Center of the Costa Rica Institute of Technology. This is a professional portfolio designed to showcase my academic and professional activities. Here you will find both technical and soft skills, as well as personal and academic projects.
home.title: Home

personalProjects.description: Here are some of my personal projects that I have developed to enhance my skills and explore new technologies.

projects.fullDescription: This project consisted of creating a control system using web sockets for a robotic arm. The system is composed of five main components: the robotic arm that uses an ESP32 board, a router that provides the network through which the other components can connect, a Node.js server installed on an Orange Pi Zero 3, an Arduino board with an HU-M16 shield that provides joysticks to control the arm, and finally a PC that connects the Arduino to the server using Python and TKinter for the graphical interface.
projects.name: Robotic Arm Controlled via Web Sockets
projects.smallDescription: Robotic arm project controlled via web sockets using an Arduino board, an ESP32 board, and a Node.js server.

personalProjects.title: Personal Projects

attentionToEmotionalAndAcademicNeeds.description: Certified for participating in the training 'Attention to Emotional and Academic Needs', held at the Instituto Tecnológico de Costa Rica.
attentionToEmotionalAndAcademicNeeds.title: Training - Attention to Emotional and Academic Needs

computingElements.description: Certified for tutoring the Computing Elements course, taught at the Limón Academic Center of the Instituto Tecnológico de Costa Rica during the first semester of 2024.
computingElements.title: Tutoring - Computing Elements

introductionToProgramming.description: Certified for tutoring the Introduction to Programming course, taught at the Limón Academic Center of the Instituto Tecnológico de Costa Rica during the first semester of 2023.
introductionToProgramming.title: Tutoring - Introduction to Programming

programmingWorkshop.description: Certified for tutoring the Programming Workshop course, taught at the Limón Academic Center of the Instituto Tecnológico de Costa Rica during the first semester of 2023.
programmingWorkshop.title: Tutoring - Programming Workshop

presentation.biography: I am a Computer Engineering student currently studying at the Limón Academic Center of the Costa Rica Institute of Technology. I am interested in topics such as robotics in healthcare, software security, web servers, compilers as a way to preserve indigenous languages, and artificial intelligence for the conservation of sea turtles. In short, I aim to improve the quality of life for people and living beings by using current technology or creating new technology.
presentation.name: Andrew López Herrera
presentation.title: Biography

GitHub.description: Visit my GitHub profile to see my projects and open-source contributions.

LinkedIn.description: Connect with me on LinkedIn to explore professional opportunities and share knowledge.

list.description: I have provided tutoring to help students understand difficult concepts and improve their programming skills.
list.title: Teaching Complex Topics

list.description: I have participated by teaching basic Excel classes to indigenous Bribri women in the Talamanca community, Costa Rica.
list.title: Social Responsibility

list.description: I have experience working in multidisciplinary teams, collaborating with others to achieve common goals.
list.title: Teamwork

list: Robotics in the medical field to improve patient care.
Creating programming languages as a way to preserve indigenous languages.
Artificial intelligence as a tool for finding turtle nests for their preservation.
Internet of Things to automate home processes and provide real-time information, for example, weather updates for hanging clothes.
technicalInterests.title: Technical Interests

compilersAndInterpreters.description: Course introducing the fundamental concepts and techniques for designing and implementing compilers and interpreters, including lexical analysis, syntax analysis, and code generation.
compilersAndInterpreters.name: Compilers and Interpreters

projects.description: OLIAC is a programming language invented in the Compilers and Interpreters course. The compiler is implemented in Java with JavaCup and generates MIPS assembly code.
projects.name: OLIAC Compiler

computingArchitecture.description: Course covering the architecture and organization of computers, including topics such as data representation, instruction set, processor architecture, memory, and input/output systems.
computingArchitecture.name: Computer Architecture

projects.description: Battleship game implemented in ARM32 assembly language.
projects.name: Battleship

databasesII.description: Course covering advanced database concepts, including database design, advanced SQL, transactions, and recovery.
databasesII.name: Databases II

projects.description: Implementation of the Wide World Importers database, including tables, relationships, stored procedures, views, and indexes.
projects.name: Wide World Importers

dataStructure.description: Course covering the fundamental concepts of data structures, including lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs, as well as algorithms to manipulate these structures.
dataStructure.name: Data Structures

projects.description: C++ library for manipulating XML files, including functions to read and modify XML in memory. Also supports self-balancing binary trees (AVL).
projects.name: XML Library

projects.description: Desktop application to visualize graphs and adjacency matrices. Allows loading graphs from text files, creating graphs, and displaying them graphically.
projects.name: Graph Viewer

engineeringSoftwareProject.description: Course where all the concepts learned throughout the degree are applied to develop a complete software project, from planning to implementation and maintenance.
engineeringSoftwareProject.name: Software Engineering Project

projects.description: Inventory and billing management system developed for SRL Technology. The system allows control of products, clients, and invoices, as well as adding, modifying, and deleting products and invoices.
projects.name: SRL GESTOCK

introductionToWebPageDevelopment.description: Course introducing the fundamental concepts and technologies for web development, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and popular frameworks.
introductionToWebPageDevelopment.name: Introduction to Web Page Development

projects.description: Research on the features of modern web development, as well as the tools and technologies currently used. The report must be written in Markdown and include screenshots.
projects.name: Lab 1 - Markdown Research

projects.description: Development of a static web page using HTML. The page should only contain the HTML structure.
projects.name: Lab 2 - Static Web Page

projects.description: The same page from Lab 2, but now using CSS for design and layout.
projects.name: Lab 3 - Dynamic Web Page

projects.description: A questionnaire made by the professor about the POUR principle, accessibility, and solving a case with sprints.
projects.name: Lab 4 - Questionnaire

projects.description: The same page from Lab 3, but now using media queries to make the page responsive.
projects.name: Lab 5 - Responsive Web Page

projects.description: This project consists of developing a prototype website for a fictional banking entity called Banco Órbita. The site must be responsive and include the following sections: Home, Login, Password Recovery, User Dashboard, Transfers Module, PIN Inquiry, and Account Review. The username and password to log in are usuario@ejemplo.com and 123456 respectively; all verification codes are 123456.
projects.name: Project 1 - Prototype of a banking entity

projects.description: Lab focused on the use of events in JavaScript to create interactivity in web pages.
projects.name: Lab 6 - Learning to use events in JavaScript

projects.description: Lab focused on the types of APIs, how they work, and usage examples.
projects.name: Lab 7 - Presentation on APIs

projects.description: Lab focused on creating and testing a RESTful API using Node.js, Express, and Postman.
projects.name: Lab 8 - Creation and testing of a RESTful API

projects.description: Lab focused on creating an API using GraphQL and Apollo Server. The API was also tested using Postman.
projects.name: Lab 9 - Creation of an API with GraphQL

projects.description: Development of an API for Banco Órbita that allows managing accounts, transactions, and clients securely and efficiently.
projects.name: Project 2 - API for Banco Órbita

projects.description: Develop a React component that consumes an API protected by an API Key, applying the useState and useEffect hooks to manage states, effects, and asynchronous requests.
projects.name: Lab 10 - Web client consuming a secure API

projects.description: Online quiz to assess the knowledge acquired in the Introduction to Web Development course.
projects.name: Lab 11 - Quiz

projects.description: Comparative presentation between the Vue.js and React.js frameworks, highlighting their features, advantages, and disadvantages.
projects.name: Lab 12 - Comparative presentation between Vue.js and React.js

projects.description: Design and implement an intelligent conversational assistant capable of answering questions about the simulated bank project, based on its data model and internal documentation, complementing the answers with information generated by the OpenAI API to maintain natural conversations and suggest possible dialogue continuations.
projects.name: Lab 13 - Chatbot with AI

operatingSystemsPrinciples.description: Course covering the fundamental principles and concepts of operating systems, including process management, memory management, file systems, and security.
operatingSystemsPrinciples.name: Operating Systems Principles

projects.description: Java simulator implementing various process scheduling algorithms, including FIFO, SJF, Round Robin, and Multilevel.
projects.name: Process Scheduler Simulator

projects.description: React simulator implementing the Selfish Round Robin memory management algorithm. This website is not responsive, because the principle objective was learning the algorithm and its implementation.
projects.name: Selfish Round Robin Memory Management Simulator

operationsResearch.description: Course that introduces the fundamental concepts and techniques of operations research, including linear programming, queueing theory, and simulation.
operationsResearch.name: Operations Research

projects.description: Implementation of dynamic programming algorithms to solve problems such as equipment replacement, optimal binary trees, sports series, and matrix multiplication.
projects.name: Dynamic Programming - Various Algorithms
